title: Top 3 love teams face off in MMFF 2015
text:
by Nestor Cuartero
October 8, 2015 JUST A THOUGHT : “The only disability in life is a bad attitude.” – Scott Hamilton
BATTLE OF LOVE TEAMS : Looks like MMFF 2015 shall witness a battle of today’s most popular young love teams, a race for the highest number of tweets and largest take at the box office.
Three of today’s hottest love teams add spice to three entries in the annual film fiesta that opens every Dec. 25 and runs for 10 days or more.
NORA AUNOR and Eddie Garcia reunite in ‘Little Mommy’
Featured as “added attractions” to the Vic Sotto-Ai Ai de las Alas romantic-comedy picture “My Bebe Love” are Alden Richards and Maine “Yaya Dub” Mendoza; James Reid and Nadine Lustre in the Vice Ganda-Coco Martin action-comedy “Beauty And The Bestie;” and Enrique Gil and Liza Soberano in the Kris Aquino-Herbert Bautista (or possibly, Derek Ramsay) entry, “Pamilya Love, Lab, Luv.”
• • •
LIZQUEN, KATHNIEL OUT : Heard at the last minute, however, LizQuen may be replaced by KimXi (Kim Chiu and Xian Lim) in the Star Cinema entry which shall now be known as “All You Need Is Pag-ibig.”
Take note that while these young love teams are last-minute additions to the casts, they aren’t just playing cameos in their respective films. They may even end up running away with the film from their more senior co-stars.
Amid all this brouhaha over today’s hottest emerging love teams, the tandem between Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla has been conveniently dislocated, if not left out in the cold.
KathNiel is the only established love team missing in MMFF 2015. The pair should work harder to claim their title as the No. 1 tandem in the scene today. Ratings-wise, their “Pangako Sa ’Yo” is facing stiff competition from JaDine’s “On The Wings Of Love.”
• • •
NORA IN “LITTLE MOMMY ”: Nora Aunor is set to start filming anytime soon her first teleserye under GMA Network, “Little Mommy.” Earlier, the superstar guested in a few episodes of another GMA production, “Pari ’Koy.”
While the title “Little Mommy” can mislead viewers into thinking Nora is the character referred to in the heading, such is not the case. Program manager Hazel Abonita explains Kris Bernal plays the intellectually challenged “Little Mommy” in the title role. Nora is cast as her grandmother, a swinging former band rocker.
“It’s a light, comedic role,” says Nora.
It is also something the public may want to see Nora in following a standard fare of heavy dramatic roles. I was telling Nora that perhaps she should pick a romantic comedy for her new film to serve as a break from all those moments of sadness in her film and TV projects.
She said she’s really on the lookout for one such role and project, preferably for film. The last time Nora did a comedy-drama was in Elwood Perez’s “Ang Totoong Buhay Ni Pacita M.” She was also most effective as a comic in “Lollipops And Roses” and “Burong Talangka,” also by Perez.
• • •
PASSION FOR ARTISTRY : On playing a supporting role, Nora has no qualms whatsoever. She believes it is her duty as a senior actor to help younger actors. She speaks of her passion for the film and TV industries as having been worth it after all these years.
“When you love your work with passion, it will honor you back,” she says. Nora’s harvest of awards and recognition from local and international bodies will be enriched furthermore by her winning the 2015 GUSI Peace Prize, where she joins an international roster of laureates in various disciplines. She is the only Filipino in the lineup of 19 awardees made up of former presidents, doctors, physicists. Awarding ceremony will be on Nov. 25 at the PICC.
Abonita clears Nora’s role is not any less important than those of her co-actors, including that of Eddie Garcia’s.
Nora is also set to start a new film, “Tuos,” to be shot entirely in Iloilo and where she plays an Ilonga native. She has been researching, studying the native tongue.
She shrieks, “Imagine mo, Bicolana ako, tapos ngayon Ilongga na ako!”
